Education

Education

Academic

I started my higher education at Olympic College in Bremerton, Washington. My original goal was to obtain a BS in Mechanical Engineering, but I took a small class in web development and the rest is history. Now, I am working on a BS in Computer Science.

SELF LEARNING

Outside of formal education, I have used several online learning resources to enhance my knowledge of Web development. The following courses were completed through udemy.com learning.

Front end

With an ever-growing list of front-end technologies being released, it is hard to keep up. My skills currently lie strongest in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and jQuery. I have been incorporating more front-end technologies such as the CSS preprocessor SASS while exploring backward compatibility and code compression with Parcel. There is so much more to absorb. My current learning efforts are focused on the popular React framework, but I hoping to explore Vue.js, Next.js, and moreâ€¦

Education

Several college classes and Udemy learning courses; along with some LinkedIn Learning tutorials.

libraries

I Have used jQuery in several projects (including this website).

skills

Worked with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SCSS, the npm ecosystem, Parcel, Git CLI with GitHub, and more. Check out the source code link in the page footer to see most of these in use on this website.

Websites

back end

Since building static webpages can easily lose its excitement, I have started exploring back-end development with Node.js. So far, I have completed one course in Node.js through udemy.com and made an extensive website and RESTful API called Natours. I am currently looking at learning PHP because of its very widespread choice as a server-side language.

As far as Data management goes, I have mainly used MySQL along with some SQLite and PostgreSQL. I completed several classes in college on SQL and Data management and a few of my Udemy.com courses incorporated SQL as part of the material. Recently, I started learning some NoSQL with MongoDB and after my first taste of NoSQL, I am excited to learn more.

Education

One Udemy Learning course on Node.js

technologies

I have used MySQL, MongoDB with Node.js, and PostgreSQL. I also lightly used SQLite with Python.

Skills

Most skilled in SQL and Node.js. I am still quite a novice in back-end technologies.

Designing

And what would a website be without a great design? Text and colors are just not enough. I love designing my web pages so that they look like professional products. My only formal training in design has been a small class on design. The rest of my learning has been a process of reading articles on designing techniques, examining hundreds of webpage designs for ideas, and trial and error. Check out some of my designs below.

Education

A college course on User Interface Design.

technologies

I mainly use Lunacy designing tool made by icons8.com. However, in college, I used Adobe XD to design web pages.

Skill level

Well, take a look at this website and the designs below and decide for yourself.
